Class AllocationResult

java.lang.Object
  org.cougaar.planning.ldm.plan.AllocationResult
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, AspectType, AuxiliaryQueryType
public class AllocationResult
extends java.lang.Object
implements AspectType, AuxiliaryQueryType, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

The "result" of allocating a task.

Constructor Detail

AllocationResult

public AllocationResult(double rating,
                        boolean success,
                        AspectValue[] aspectvalues)
Constructor that takes a result in the form of AspectValues (NON-PHASED). Subclasses of AspectValue, such as TypedQuantityAspectValue are allowed.

Parameters:
rating - The confidence rating of this result.
success - Whether the allocationresult violated any preferences.
aspectvalues - The AspectValues(can be aspectvalue subclasses) that represent the results.

AllocationResult

public AllocationResult(double rating,
                        boolean success,
                        int[] keys,
                        double[] values)
Deprecated. Use #AllocationResult(double,boolean,AspectValue[]) instead because AspectValues are not all describable by double values.

AllocationResult

public AllocationResult(double rating,
                        boolean success,
                        AspectValue[] rollupavs,
                        java.util.Enumeration allresults)
Deprecated. Use #AllocationResult(double, boolean, AspectValue[], Collection) instead.

Simple Constructor for a PHASED result

Parameters:
rating - The confidence rating of this result.
success - Whether the allocationresult violated any preferences.
rollupavs - The Summary (or rolled up) AspectValues that represent the results.
allresults - An Enumeration of either AspectValue[]s or Collections.

                        boolean success,
                        int[] keys,
                        double[] values,
                        java.util.Enumeration allresults)
Deprecated. Use #AllocationResult(double,boolean,AspectValue[],Collection) instead because AspectValues are not all describable by double values.

AllocationResult

public AllocationResult(double rating,
                        boolean success,
                        AspectValue[] rollupavs,
                        java.util.Collection phasedresults)
Constructor that takes a PHASED result in the form of AspectValues. Subclasses of AspectValue, such as TypedQuantityAspectValue are allowed.

Parameters:
rating - The confidence rating of this result.
success - Whether the allocationresult violated any preferences.
rollupavs - The Summary (or rolled up) AspectValues that represent the results.
phasedresults - A Collections of the phased results. The Collection should contain one Collection or AspectValue[] of AspectValues for each phase of the results.

AllocationResult

public AllocationResult(AllocationResult ar1,
                        AllocationResult ar2)
Construct a merged AllocationResult containing AspectValues from two AllocationResults. If both arguments have the same aspects, the values from the first (dominant) result are used. The result is never phased.

Method Detail

public static AllocationResult newAllocationResult(double rating,
                                                   boolean success,
                                                   AspectValue[] avs)
Factory that takes a result in the form of AspectValues (NON-PHASED). Subclasses of AspectValue, such as TypedQuantityAspectValue are allowed.

Parameters:
rating - The confidence rating of this result.
success - Whether the allocationresult violated any preferences.
avs - The AspectValues(can be aspectvalue subclasses) that represent the results.

newAllocationResult

public static AllocationResult newAllocationResult(double rating,
                                                   boolean success,
                                                   AspectValue[] rollupavs,
                                                   java.util.Collection phasedresults)
AllocationResult factory that takes a PHASED result in the form of AspectValues. Subclasses of AspectValue, such as TypedQuantityAspectValue are allowed.

Parameters:
rating - The confidence rating of this result.
success - Whether the allocationresult violated any preferences.
rollupavs - The Summary (or rolled up) AspectValues that represent the results.
phasedresults - A Collections of the phased results. The Collection should contain one Collection or AspectValue[] of AspectValues for each phase of the results.

newAllocationResult

public static AllocationResult newAllocationResult(AllocationResult ar1,
                                                   AllocationResult ar2)
Construct a merged AllocationResult containing AspectValues from two AllocationResults. If both arguments have the same aspects, the values from the first (dominant) result are used. The result is never phased.

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object

getValue

public double getValue(int aspectType)
Get the result with respect to a given AspectType. If the AllocationResult is phased, this method will return the summary value of the given AspectType.

Warning!!! Not all AspectValues can be simply represented as a double. Use of this method with such AspectValues is undefined.

Parameters:
aspectType -
Returns:
double The result of a given dimension. For example, getValue(AspectType.START_TIME) returns the Task start time. Note : results are not required to contain data in each dimension - check the array of defined aspecttypes or ask if a specific dimension is defined. If there is a request for a value of an undefined aspect, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
See Also:
AspectType

getAspectValue

public AspectValue getAspectValue(int aspectType)
Get the AspectValue of the result with the specified type

isDefined

public boolean isDefined(int aspectType)
Quick check to see if one aspect is defined as opposed to looking through the AspectType array.

Parameters:
aspectType - The aspect you are checking
Returns:
boolean Represents whether this aspect is defined
See Also:
AspectType

isSuccess

public boolean isSuccess()
Returns:
boolean Represents whether or not the allocation was a success. If any Constraints were violated by the allocation, then the isSuccess() method returns false and the Plugin that created the subtask should recognize this event. The Expander may re-expand, change the Constraints or Preferences, or indicate failure to its superior. The AspectValues of a failed allocation may be set by the Allocator with values that would be more likely to be successful. The Expander can use these new values as suggestions when resetting the Preferences

isPhased

public boolean isPhased()
Returns:
boolean Represents whether or not the allocation result is phased.

getAspectTypes

public int[] getAspectTypes()
A Collection of AspectTypes representative of the type and order of the aspects in each the result.

Returns:
int[] The array of AspectTypes
See Also:
AspectType

getResult

public double[] getResult()
A collection of doubles that represent the result for each AspectType. If the result is phased, the results are summarized.

Warning!!! Not all AspectValues can be simply represented as a double. Use of this method with such AspectValues is undefined.

Returns:
double[]

getAspectValueResults

public AspectValue[] getAspectValueResults()
A collection of AspectValues that represent the result for each preference. Note that subclasses of AspectValue such as TypedQuantityAspectValue may be used. If this was not defined through a constructor, one will be built from the result and aspecttype arrays. In this case only true AspectValue objects will be build (no subclasses of AspectValues). The AspectValues of a failed allocation may be set by the Allocator with values that would be more likely to be successful. The Expander can use these new values as suggestions when resetting the Preferences.

getPhasedResults

public java.util.Enumeration getPhasedResults()
A collection of arrays that represents each phased result. If the result is not phased, use AllocationResult.getResult()

Warning!!! Not all AspectValues can be simply represented as a double. Use of this method with such AspectValues is undefined.

Returns:
Enumeration

getPhasedAspectValueResults

public java.util.List getPhasedAspectValueResults()
A List of Lists that represent each phased result in the form of AspectValues. If the result is not phased, use getAspectValueResults()

Returns:
A List. If the AllocationResult is not phased, will return null.

getConfidenceRating

public double getConfidenceRating()
Returns:
double The confidence rating of this result.

Parameters:

Returns:
String The string representing the data matching the type requested Note: may return null if nothing was defined
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the int passed in as an argument is not a defined AuxiliaryQueryType
